summary: Project involves room-based messaging; user reports inability to create/join rooms and send/receive messages, and requests that users be able to join with a nickname (guest) without requiring Internet Identity.
architectural_notes: Support guest/unauthenticated users identified by nickname for room join flow (do not require Internet Identity for joining).
known_issues: Users are unable to create or join rooms (UI shows: "Unable to create room. Please try again or join an existing room.").
Users are unable to send or receive messages (generic error while sending).

existing_features.title: Update frontend room create/join and message send flows to work in guest mode (anonymous actor) without requiring Internet Identity, and ensure errors are surfaced as clear guest-friendly messages instead of generic failures.

Fix the "unable to send or receive messages" failure mode by aligning frontend expectations with backend behavior (backend traps on failure; frontend should not rely on sentinel return values like messageId === 0n).

new_feature_requests.summary: Allow users to join rooms as guests using only a nickname (no Internet Identity required)
Remove the requirement for Internet Identity / AccessControl "#user" permission for core chat operations so that any caller can create rooms, read messages, and send messages using only a nickname.

Add backend-side validation for guest identity inputs so nickname-based usage is safe and consistent: require a non-empty nickname, trim whitespace, and enforce a reasonable max length consistent with the frontend (20 chars).

projectName: Allow guest users to join/create rooms with only a nickname (no Internet Identity required) and restore messaging
